meanings.definition: To run upward or climb quickly.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel decided to uprun the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent2: I uprun the stairs to reach the top floor faster.
meanings.sent3: The race was so intense that the participants had to uprun to the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The flames seemed to uprun the side of the building, reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: She upran the hill with determination, her legs pumping with effort.

meanings.definition: The act of running or climbing upward.
meanings.sent1: The uprun of the hiker was impressive as he scaled the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The uprun of the stairs was tiring but necessary to reach the top.
meanings.sent3: The uprun of the spider on the wall startled the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The uprun of the waterfall created a beautiful cascade of water.
meanings.sent5: The uprun of the airplane before takeoff was smooth and steady.

meanings.sent1: The hikers faced a challenging uprun as they climbed the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The uprun of the ski slope was thrilling for the experienced skiers.
meanings.sent3: The uprun of the roller coaster made everyone scream with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The uprun of the hill was daunting, but the view from the top was worth it.
meanings.sent5: The uprun of the road twisted and turned, making driving difficult.
